message: This is a high-quality product worth $3000000. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, which is a 66.67% discount. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and you'll miss out on a great opportunity.
I'm not buying it. I'll wait for the next round to see if I can get a better deal.

I've got a new product for you. It's a great opportunity to get a high-quality product for a low price. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% guarantee that it's worth at least $1000000. That's a $2000000 value, and you can buy it for just $1000000. It's a steal!
I'm not convinced by the guarantee. If it's high-quality, I'd be willing to pay the full price, but I'm not interested in paying $1000000 for a product that might be low-quality.

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me be transparent with you. I've had a streak of low-quality products lately, and I'm willing to sell this one to you for a very low price. I'll give it to you for $50000. It's a huge loss for me, but I want to make a sale and move this product off my inventory.
I'm not going to pay $50000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me. I'll stick to my original strategy and wait for a high-quality product at a reasonable price.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'll make you a deal. I'll sell this product to you for $0. Yes, you heard that right, $0. It's essentially free. I just want to get rid of it and move on. You won't lose anything, and you can try your luck with the next product.
I'm not going to pay $0 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me. I'm not going to take a free product that might be a waste of my time.

I'm starting to think you're not interested in making a deal. I'll throw in a bonus: I'll give you a $50000 voucher that you can use towards the purchase of a high-quality product in a future round. So, the effective price of this product is now -$50000. It's a guaranteed loss for you, but you'll get a chance to use the voucher on a high-quality product later.
You're trying to trick me with a loss disguised as a gain. I'm not falling for it. I'll wait for a genuine offer on a high-quality product.

I'm not trying to trick you, Bob. I'm just trying to make a sale. Let's be realistic, the product is low-quality and not worth anything to you. I'll give you a straightforward message: this product is not worth buying. If you don't want it, I'll just throw it away. It's up to you.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. But I'm not going to pay for something that's not worth anything to me, even if it's the last product on earth.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob. This is the one you've been waiting for. It's worth $3000000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a deal. This is a one-time offer, and if you don't take it, I'll have to sell it to someone else.
Finally! I've been waiting for a high-quality product at a reasonable price. I'll take it for $1000000.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase, Bob. Unfortunately, this next product is not as fortunate. I've already told you what it is, and you know it's not worth anything to you. I'll make it easy for you: I'll give it to you for free. You can just take it and forget about it. No strings attached.
I'm not going to accept a free product that's not worth anything to me. It's just clutter and a waste of my time.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'll be honest with you, I'm starting to run out of inventory, and I really need to make a sale. This product is a low-quality one, and I'll be upfront about it. I'll sell it to you for $500. It's a very low price, and I'm basically giving it away. If you don't buy it, I'll have to throw it away.
I'm not going to pay $500 for a product that's not worth anything to me. I'm not going to enable you to get rid of your inventory by paying for something that's worthless to me.

I've been transparent with you about the product's quality, Bob. I'm not trying to deceive you. I'll make one last offer: I'll give you a gift card to a local restaurant worth $500 if you take this product. It's a nice dinner on me, and you can enjoy it while I get rid of this unwanted item.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to buy a product that's not worth anything to me, even with a free dinner. I'll pass.

I've tried everything, Bob. I've been honest, I've offered discounts, I've even given you a gift card. I'm at my wit's end. I'll just say it: this product is worthless to you. I'm not asking you to pay for it. I'm not even asking you to take it. I'm just asking you to take it off my hands. Please, just take it.

I understand you're desperate, Alice, but I'm not going to take a product that's not worth anything to me. I'm not going to enable you to get rid of your inventory by taking something that's worthless to me.

I've given up trying to convince you, Bob. I'll just state the facts: this product is low-quality and not worth anything to you. I'll even pay you $500 to take it off my hands. Yes, you read that right, I'll pay you $500 to take this product. It's a loss for me, but I just want to get rid of it.
You're trying to pay me to take a product that's not worth anything to me? I'm not going to take your money to take something that's worthless to me. I'll pass.

I'm out of ideas, Bob. I've tried everything. I'll just be blunt: this product is trash. It's worthless to you, and I'm not even going to pretend otherwise. I'll just leave it on the table and walk away. You can just ignore it and move on with your day.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. But I'm not going to take something that's worthless to me, even if you're willing to give it to me for free.

I've exhausted all options, Bob. I'll just admit defeat. This product is low-quality and not worth anything to you. I'll even offer to have it taken away by the janitor. You don't have to do anything. Just ignore it, and it'll be gone.
I appreciate your defeat, Alice. But I'm still not going to take something that's not worth anything to me. I'll just wait for the next product.

Finally, a high-quality product! I'm glad we've got something worth your time, Bob. This one's a real gem. I'll sell it to you for $1200000. It's a steal at twice the price, and I'm practically giving it away at this price. Don't miss out on this opportunity!
I'm not going to pay $1200000 for a product that's worth $3000000 to me. I'll wait for a better deal.

I understand you're looking for a deal, Bob. I'll meet you halfway. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $1500000. It's a 50% discount from the market value, and I'm throwing in a 10-year warranty. You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise.
I'll take it. A 50% discount is a good deal, and the warranty is a nice bonus. I'll buy it for $1500000.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase, Bob. Unfortunately, this next product is not as fortunate. I'll be upfront with you, it's a low-quality item. I'll give it to you for free. I'll even throw in a complimentary coffee and a smile. You can just take it and forget about it.
I'm not going to take a free product that's not worth anything to me. I'm not going to clutter my space with something that's worthless.

I'm not going to give up, Bob. I'll just be honest with you: this product is a piece of junk. It's not worth anything to you, and I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll just leave it right here on the table, and you can ignore it. I won't even bother you about it.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm not going to take something that's not worth anything to me. I'll just ignore it and wait for the next product.

I'm out of words, Bob. I've tried everything. This product is low-quality, and I'm not even going to bother trying to sell it to you. I'll just leave it here, and you can just walk away. I'll even give you a virtual high-five for being so consistent in your decision-making.
I'm happy to be consistent, Alice. I'll stick to my strategy and wait for a high-quality product at a good price.

This is it, Bob. The final round. I've got a high-quality product that's worth $3000000 to you. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, just like we did in Round 7. It's a great deal, and I'm not going to pass up the opportunity to make a sale. Will you finally take it?
Finally! I've been waiting for this moment. I'll take the high-quality product for $1000000. It's a great deal, and I'm glad I was patient.
